$\begin{align}
x' = x\cos(\theta) - y\sin(\theta) \\
y' = x\sin(\theta) + y\cos(\theta)
\end{align}$

A rotation of $240^\circ$ clockwise is equivalent to a rotation of $-240^\circ$ counter-clockwise.

$\begin{align}
x' &= 6 \cdot \cos(-240^\circ) - (-2) \cdot \sin(-240^\circ) \\
y' &= 6 \cdot \sin(-240^\circ) + (-2) \cdot \cos(-240^\circ)
\end{align}$
